title: Market report: Beer giant goes down fast as WPP soars after return to growth
text:
Shares in the world’s biggest beer brewer took a spill on Friday.

Brussels- listed AB InBev – which makes Budweiser and Stella Artois, among others – dropped €9.17, or 11pc, to €73.68, after it cut its forecast for profit growth this year.

The Belgian company said beer volume fell 0.9pc in the three months to September, although revenues rose 2.7pc to $13.2bn (£10.3bn).

The brewer described the quarter as “challenging” on Friday and said it now expected “moderate” rather than “strong” profit increases.

It wasn’t the only major European faller. Video game-maker Ubisoft’s share price crashed by almost a third after it warned on Thursday that poor performances by two recently released titles had...
description: Shares in the world’s biggest beer brewer took a spill on Friday.
